author: mklement0
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

Per request from @SteveL-MSFT:

#10631 asks for tab completion for values assigned to variables whose type is a simple `System.Enum`-derived type.

This support should be extended to also work for flag (bit-field) enumerations, so that something like the following would work:

```powershell
# Sample flags enumeration.
[Flags()] enum Foo { first = 0x1; second = 0x2; third = 0x4 }

# Tab-complete flag values inside strings too (with or without a closing quote present).
[Foo] $v = 'first, th'<tab>  # -> 'first, third', tantamount to [Foo]::first -bor [Foo]::third
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Note that casting _arrays_ of names works too, the following should work as well:

```powershell
# Tab-complete individual array elements
[Foo] $v = 'first', 'th<tab> 
```

title: Enable tab completion for variables that are of a flag (bit-field) enum type
